entry.title: Kitchen Scraps Recycling Pilot Project
entry.content: A total of 19.42 tonnes of kitchen scraps were diverted from the landfill and recycled as part of the three month pilot project. With 95% of households participating, response to the pilot project was terrific.
entry.summary: A total of 19.42 tonnes of kitchen scraps were diverted from the landfill and recycled as part of the three month pilot project. With 95% of households participating, response to the pilot project was terrific.

entry.title: Golf Course Public Consultation
entry.content:
The survey that followed the June 20th open house is now closed and Elevate Consulting is now reviewing all the input collected through the Open House, surveys and stakeholder interviews. We will keep you updated on their progress as we move towards a recommendation, likely in the middle of August 2012.

If you would like more information or have questions please contact Saanich Parks and Recreation (recreation@saanich.ca, 250 475-5422).
entry.summary:
The survey that followed the June 20th open house is now closed and Elevate Consulting is now reviewing all the input collected through the Open House, surveys and stakeholder interviews. We will keep you updated on their progress as we move towards a recommendation, likely in the middle of August 2012.

If you would like more information or have questions please contact Saanich Parks and Recreation (recreation@saanich.ca, 250 475-5422).

entry.summary: The District of Saanich has developed a Master Plan to guide the direction of the Parks & Recreation Department over the next 5 – 7 years. The Plan will be considered by Council at their July 9/12 Committee of the Whole meeting.

entry.title: Shelbourne Valley Action Plan Transportation Study Overview
entry.content: A powerpoint presentation of the Shelbourne Valley Action Plan Transportation Study is available for viewing. The Study includes a review of concepts and recommended Corridor improvements for walking, cycling, transit and private motor vehicle use through the Shelbourne Corridor. The full study is available for viewing under the Transportation section of the plan page.
entry.summary: A powerpoint presentation of the Shelbourne Valley Action Plan Transportation Study is available for viewing. The Study includes a review of concepts and recommended Corridor improvements for walking, cycling, transit and private motor vehicle use through the Shelbourne Corridor. The full study is available for viewing under the Transportation section of the plan page.

entry.title: Property Tax Notices Have Been Mailed
entry.content: The 2012 property tax notices were mailed on May 22, 2012. Taxpayers who have not received their tax notice should contact the Saanich Tax Office by July 3, 2012 to avoid penalty. All unpaid taxes (including unclaimed home owner grants) are subject to a 10% penalty after July 3rd.
entry.summary: The 2012 property tax notices were mailed on May 22, 2012. Taxpayers who have not received their tax notice should contact the Saanich Tax Office by July 3, 2012 to avoid penalty. All unpaid taxes (including unclaimed home owner grants) are subject to a 10% penalty after July 3rd.

entry.title: Appointment to Saanich Police Board
entry.content: Saanich residents interested in an appointment to the Saanich Police Board are invited to submit a letter of application and accompanying résumé by 4:00 pm, Friday, June 15, 2012.
entry.summary: Saanich residents interested in an appointment to the Saanich Police Board are invited to submit a letter of application and accompanying résumé by 4:00 pm, Friday, June 15, 2012.

entry.title: Saanich Council Appoints New Chief Administrative Officer
entry.content: Paul Murray has been appointed Chief Administrative Officer effective June 1, 2012. The current Chief Administrative Officer, Tim Wood, is retiring on May 31, 2012.
entry.summary: Paul Murray has been appointed Chief Administrative Officer effective June 1, 2012. The current Chief Administrative Officer, Tim Wood, is retiring on May 31, 2012.

entry.title: Kitchen Scraps Recycling Pilot Project Launched in Saanich UPDATE
entry.content: 583 households are participating in a pilot project to help us evaluate kitchen scraps recycling and collection models in our municipality in anticipation of the CRD ban on kitchen scraps at the Hartland landfill by 2015. Read the CRD media advisory.
entry.summary: 583 households are participating in a pilot project to help us evaluate kitchen scraps recycling and collection models in our municipality in anticipation of the CRD ban on kitchen scraps at the Hartland landfill by 2015. Read the CRD media advisory.
